DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To evaluate efficacy robot-assisted gait training ( RAGT ) MS patient severe walk disability ( Expanded Disability Status Scale [ EDSS ] 5.5-7 ) compare regular physiotherapy . Methods : Prospective , randomize , control clinical trial compare RAGT conventional walk training ( CWT ) group stable MS patient ( n=40 ) outpatient rehabilitation program . Inclusion criterion chronic secondary progressive MS patient EDSS 5.5-7 , stable treatment 3 month study entry , without generalize disease . All patient sign inform consent . Following randomization , 20 patient treated RAGT , 12 session three week . The control group treat CWT , 12 session three week . The primary outcome measure Functional Ambulatory Capacity ( FAC ) scale 6-minutes walking distance . The secondary outcome measure Time & Go ( TUG ) test , 10 Meter Walking test , Berg balance test , EDSS score , FIM score RAND questioner quality life . All test perform external blind assessor baseline , three week , follow-up 3 month six month . Importance : We anticipate Robot-assisted gait training find feasible may effective therapeutic option MS patient severe walk disability .
